title: Job vacancies at Cecure Intelligence Limited
content:
Cecure Intelligence Limited - Building digital products with modern technologies excites us. We take an idea through our curated delivery process to create tangible outcomes for our customers quickly. This enables you to truly validate your idea and derive immediate benefit.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Partnerships Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type:Full-time

Role Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking a Partnership Manager to lead and grow strategic OEM and ISV relationships.
	This role is central to expanding our partner portfolio, driving tier and specialty growth, and executing joint Go-to-Market (GTM) initiatives that generate measurable, partnership-led revenue.
	You will ensure our partnerships remain aligned with business strategy, compliant with standards, and responsive to market needs.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead the full partner lifecycle, from onboarding to retention and tier growth
	Manage quarterly partner business reviews and track performance against targets
	Drive partner certifications, tier upgrades, and specialty achievements
	Own joint GTM planning, including MDF utilization and co-branded campaigns
	Collaborate with Sales to grow partner-led pipeline and revenue
	Manage partner incentives, rebates, and funding utilization
	Ensure ISO-compliant partner processes in collaboration with Compliance
	Maintain strong OEM/ISV relationships through structured monthly and quarterly reviews
	Deliver accurate reporting on partnership performance and program compliance


Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field
	Master’s degree or relevant professional certifications are an advantage.


Skills and Experience Required:


	2–4 years of experience managing OEM and/or ISV partnerships
	Strong relationship-building skills across executive and operational levels
	Solid understanding of sales processes, GTM execution, and partner financials
	Proven success driving revenue through joint GTM initiatives
	Experience with partner lifecycle management and tier growth strategies
	Excellent communication and presentation skills
	Strong reporting and dashboard management capabilities
	Experience working within structured compliance or ISO-aligned environments


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@cecureintel.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Account Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type:Full-time

Role Overview


	We are seeking an Account Manager to drive business growth by generating new opportunities, expanding existing accounts, and maintaining a healthy pipeline through proactive engagement.
	You will manage the full sales cycle, build strong customer relationships, and contribute to both individual and team revenue targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Generate new business opportunities and meet new logo targets
	Expand existing customer accounts with a focus on wallet share and cross-selling
	Manage the full sales cycle: discovery, proposal, negotiation, and closure
	Conduct consistent outbound prospecting and sales activities
	Maintain accurate CRM records and generate Sales Qualified Leads (SQLs)
	Build and nurture strong customer relationships through structured Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs)
	Collaborate with Presales, Delivery, Finance, and Marketing teams to support deal execution
	Support contract negotiation, documentation, and compliance processes
	Achieve individual revenue targets and contribute to team goals


Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field
	A master’s degree or relevant professional certifications are an advantage


Skills and Experience Required:


	Minimum 5 years of experience as an Account Manager or Sales Executive in technology/OEM/ISV sales
	Proven track record in meeting/exceeding revenue and new logo acquisition targets
	Strong experience managing large, complex sales pipelines with high CRM data integrity
	Expertise in strategic account expansion and B2B sales cycle management
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and proposal development skills
	Proven ability to build long-term, high-value customer relationships
	Proficiency in CRM software and pipeline management


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@cecureintel.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Learning and Development Associate

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type:Full-time

Role Overview


	We are seeking a Learning and Development Associate to support the day-to-day execution and delivery of training programs within the CIL Academy.
	This role is focused on tactical execution and operational excellence, ensuring training programs run smoothly, learners remain engaged, and program performance is accurately tracked and reported.
	You will play a key role in coordinating training logistics, supporting learners, maintaining learning systems, and providing reliable insights through operational reporting.


Key Responsibilities


	Coordinate all logistical aspects of online and in-person training programs
	Manage the end-to-end learner lifecycle, including enrollment, assessments, and onboarding
	Track learner progress, attendance, and participation, escalating issues that require intervention
	Provide first-level technical support to learners using the Learning Management System (LMS) and training environments
	Maintain operational dashboards and prepare routine progress and performance reports
	Support the distribution and minor updates of learning materials as required


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent) in Human Resources, Education, or a technology-related field
	Advanced degrees or relevant certifications are an added advantage
	Certification or training in instructional design, facilitation, coaching, training, or leadership development is a plus.


Skills and Experience Required


	1–3 years of experience in a learning, training, or similar coordination role
	Strong organizational, coordination, and attention-to-detail skills
	Process-driven mindset with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills for engaging learners, instructors, and internal stakeholders
	Ability to quickly learn and support digital learning platforms (LMS and virtual environments)
	Proficiency in data tracking, dashboards, and basic reporting tools (e.g., spreadsheets or LMS reporting features)
	Strong customer service orientation and commitment to delivering a positive learner experience
	Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented, fast-paced environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@cecureintel.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Openings at Olam Agri
content:
Olam Agri is a market-leading, differentiated food, feed, and fiber agri-business with a global origination footprint, processing capabilities, and deep understanding of market needs built over 33 years. With a strong presence in high-growth emerging markets and products across grains & oilseeds, animal feed & protein, rice, edible oils, specialty grains & seeds, cotton, wood products, rubber and commodity financial services.

Olam Agri is at the heart of global food and agri-trade flows with more than 40 million MT in volume traded annually. Focused on transforming food, feed and fiber for a more sustainable future, it aims at creating value for customers, enabling farming communities to prosper sustainably, and strive for a food-secure future.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Packing Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description


	The Packing Manager is responsible for overseeing and optimizing all packing operations within Olamagri’s facility in Lagos.
	This role ensures that goods are efficiently and effectively packed according to specifications, quality standards, and timelines for storage and shipment.
	The Packing Manager will manage a team of packing staff, implement and maintain efficient packing processes, ensure the proper use of packing materials, and collaborate with other departments such as Production, Warehouse, and Logistics.
	The ideal candidate will have strong organizational and leadership skills, a focus on efficiency and quality, and a commitment to safety and Olam's core values of being Collaborative, Agile, Resourceful, Entrepreneurial, and Sustainable.


Key Deliverables


	Packing Operations Management: Plan, organize, and supervise all packing activities to ensure efficient and timely completion of packing schedules.
	Team Leadership & Supervision: Lead, train, and manage the packing team, including assigning tasks, monitoring performance, providing feedback, and ensuring adherence to standard operating procedures (SOPs).
	Packing Standards & Quality Control: Establish and enforce packing standards and quality control procedures to ensure products are packed correctly, securely, and according to specifications, minimizing damage during transit and storage.
	Packing Material Management: Monitor and manage the usage of packing materials, ensuring appropriate materials are used, minimizing waste, and coordinating with the Procurement team for timely and adequate supply.
	Efficiency & Process Improvement: Continuously evaluate and optimize packing processes to improve efficiency, reduce bottlenecks, and increase throughput. Implement best practices in packing methodologies.
	Equipment Maintenance & Safety: Ensure that all packing equipment is in good working order, schedule regular maintenance, and enforce safety regulations within the packing area to prevent accidents and injuries.


Strategic Effectiveness:


	Coordination with Other Departments: Collaborate closely with Production to understand output schedules, with the Warehouse team for storage requirements, and with Logistics for shipment preparation.
	Problem Solving: Address and resolve any issues or delays that arise during the packing process in a timely and effective manner.
	Performance Monitoring & Reporting: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to packing operations (e.g., packing efficiency, error rates, material usage) and provide regular reports to management.
	Sustainability in Packing: Implement practices to minimize packing material waste, explore more sustainable packing options where feasible, and promote responsible disposal of packing waste.


Operational Effectiveness:


	Efficient and Timely Packing Operations: Consistent completion of packing schedules according to production and shipment requirements.
	High-Quality Packing Standards: Ensuring goods are packed correctly and securely, minimizing damage and returns.
	Effective Team Performance: A well-trained, motivated, and productive packing team.
	Optimized Packing Processes: Continuous improvement in packing efficiency and throughput.
	Minimized Packing Material Waste: Efficient use of packing materials and implementation of waste reduction initiatives.
	Safe Working Environment: Ensuring adherence to safety regulations and minimizing workplace accidents in the packing area.
	Accurate Packing Records: Maintenance of accurate records of packed goods and packing material usage.
	Smooth Coordination with Other Departments: Effective communication and collaboration with Production, Warehouse, and Logistics teams.
	Adherence to Packing Budgets: Operating within allocated budget for packing materials and operations.
	Contribution to Operational Efficiency: Positive impact on the overall efficiency of the supply chain.


Requirements


	Education: Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, relevant professional certifications in packaging would be an advantage.
	Experience: Minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in packing development and management, preferably within the food, agricultural, or FMCG sectors.
	Experience working with a variety of packaging materials and technologies is essential.


Technical Skills:


	Good understanding of packing methods and techniques for various types of goods.
	Familiarity with different packing materials (e.g., cartons, wrapping materials, strapping).
	Understanding of safety procedures in a packing environment.
	Language Skills: Fluency in English is essential. Proficiency in other relevant local languages would be an advantage.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Treasury Analyst

Job Location: Nigeria

Job Description


	The Treasury (TSF) Manager will manage cash flow, trade finance instruments, FX transactions, and banking operations in compliance with Nigerian regulatory frameworks.
	This role ensures liquidity for procurement, production, and export activities while optimizing costs and mitigating financial risks.
	The candidate must be conversant with CBN FX policies, Form M/PAAR processes, export proceeds repatriation timelines, and Nigerian banking practices.


Key Deliverables


	Cash & Liquidity Management: Prepare daily cash positions and weekly rolling cashflow forecasts; monitor variances and recommend corrective actions. Manage working capital across procurement, production, and distribution cycles. Ensure timely funding for import and local procurement transactions.
	Trade & Structured Finance (TSF): Process Form M applications and ensure compliance with CBN guidelines for imports. Coordinate PAAR issuance and liaise with banks/customs for documentation. Manage Letters of Credit (LCs), Bills for Collection, Bank Guarantees, and SBLCs for import/export transactions. Track TSF facility utilization and ensure adherence to bank limits and conditions.
	FX & Risk Management: Monitor FX exposures and execute transactions through CBN FX windows (e.g., I&E window, official window) in line with company policy. Liaise with banks for FX bids and ensure compliance with CBN FX allocation rules. Track export proceeds and ensure repatriation within CBN timelines (currently 90 days); maintain documentation for regulatory audits. Support hedging strategies where applicable.


Strategic Effectiveness


	Banking Relationships & Operations: Maintain strong relationships with Nigerian commercial banks and development finance institutions. Handle account openings, KYC updates, and e-channel setups (e.g., Remita, NIBSS Instant Payment). Negotiate bank charges and FX spreads; benchmark against market rates. Ensure compliance with bank covenants and maintain updated covenant trackers.
	Treasury Systems & Controls: Operate ERP and reconcile treasury transactions with GL. Maintain robust internal controls over payments and TSF documentation. Prepare monthly treasury reports: cashflow, FX exposure, facility utilization, and compliance dashboards.
	Regulatory Compliance: Ensure adherence to CBN FX regulations, BOFIA, and trade documentation requirements. Maintain accurate records for Form M, PAAR, LC documentation, and export proceeds for internal and external audits. Support compliance with Nigerian tax and customs regulations related to trade finance.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field; ACA/ACCA or CTP certification is an advantage.
	2–4 years of experience in treasury, trade finance, or banking operations within Nigeria.
	Strong knowledge of CBN FX policies, Form M/PAAR processes, and Nigerian banking ecosystem.
	Proficiency in ERP systems and Intermediate Excel.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Plant Manager

Job Location: Ilorin, Kwara

Job Description


	The role encompasses in managing day to day activity of the plant in the country handling all function from production, processing, quality, Engineering & Projects and QEHS. Specific Knowledge: Knowledge of Food Safety Management systems / HACCP/FSSC / BRC / ISO 14000 and management of Industrial relations is required for the role.


Strategic Effectiveness


	Produce and Deliver products - Manage production activities and services.
	Review shop floor operations daily for adherence to Quality systems & norms. Lead and support in process/system related issues. Support Preventive Maintenance schedule for Plant & Machinery and related Engineering activities.
	Produce & deliver products – Optimize production costs - Consolidate variances, analyze and find our root causes and plan for actions accordingly. Manage line OEEs, wastages and conversion costs through effective monitoring, review & control.
	QEHS - Lead the QEHS initiatives and work with the Central Quality Head in delivering the goals. To commission sustainable systems to hold the gains.
	Engineering & Projects - To implement best practices in Plant maintenance, thereby improving the OEE. Manage Maintenance & repairs cost within the budgeted levels. Ensure delivery of Projects within the Scope, Cost & Time.
	Cost efficiency Programs - Should lead Cost efficiency and continual improvement programs. Identify opportunities, base line and execute projects amongst cross functional teams.
	Manage Industrial relations - Actively participate & lead IR discussions. Negotiate with various Unions, ensure Industrial discipline is maintained and labor productivity is increased on a regular basis.
	Budget and Budgetary control - Chalk out budgets for Labor, energy, materials, maintenance & other Plant overheads effectively and implement


Requirements


	Candidate with extensive exposure in Plant management / Project activities, good exposure towards team a management.
	15-20 Years of work exposure in Leading FMCG Company, with engineering degree from a reputed college
	Biscuits, Wafers & Bakery manufacturing experience will be preferred.

title: Job Openings at Max Drive
content:
Max Drive - We are a team of passionate people and a leading technology-enabled company driven by a vision to solve the mobility challenges in Africa. We want to get people and goods to their destinations hitch-free. It is personal for us because we understand the frustration of epileptic transportation. We are making mobility safe, affordable, accessible, and sustainable through the deployment of high-performance technologies and operators.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) IT & Infrastructure Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Description
     

            
    




	As the IT & Infrastructure  Manager at MAX, you will play a critical role in ensuring the design, installation, supervision, implementation, and maintenance of MAX’s computing needs. You will ensure the secure and effective operation of all computer systems, related applications, hardware, and software used within MAX services.


 Responsibilities


	Manage information technology and computer systems
	Plan, organize, control and evaluate IT and electronic data operations
	Manage IT staff by recruiting, training and coaching employees, communicating job expectations and appraising their performance
	Design, develop, implement and coordinate IT systems, policies and procedures
	Ensure security of data, network access and backup systems
	Act in alignment with user needs and system functionality to contribute to organizational policy
	Audit systems and assess their outcomes
	Preserve assets, information security and control structures
	Handle annual budget and ensure cost effectiveness
	Monitor performance of information technology systems to determine cost and productivity levels, and make recommendations for improving the IT infrastructure
	Consult computer users to ascertain needs and to ensure that facilities meet user or project requirements
	provide user training, support, advice, and feedback
	Test and modify systems to ensure that they operate reliably
	Manage secure network access for remote users
	Ensure network components meet needs and work together seamlessly, using the full range of capabilities, and stay informed about new features and competitive solutions
	Continuously analyze current processes, technologies, and vendors to identify areas of improvement
	Develop and execute disaster procedures, and maintain data backups
	Analyze department needs, identify vulnerabilities, and boost productivity, efficiency and accuracy to inform business decisions


Requirements
What You’ll Need: 


	Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems, or any other related course
	3+ years of management or supervisory experience
	7+ years of cognate experience in IT operations
	Proven experience (between 3 & 5 years)  in operations management, especially in a field-related role.
	Experience leading and managing large IT projects and rolling out IT infrastructures across various technologies
	Excellent working knowledge of computer systems, security, network and systems administration, databases and data storage systems, and phone systems
	Strong critical thinking and decision-making skills
	Excellent project management skills and strong ability to prioritize
	Firm grasp on IT infrastructure and operations best practices.


Benefits


	Competitive pay & benefits
	Premium Health insurance cover
	Consistent Learning and Development.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Inventory Officer

Job Location: Ado Ekiti, Ekiti

Responsibilities


	Receive, store, issue the goods, managing the stock levels and giving out the supplies from the stock
	Ensuring the preparation of inventories, maintaining the stock records, using computerized systems for entering the records and is accountable for checking the supply invoices with the purchase orders.
	Source out for suppliers and ensure that quotes are obtained as well.
	Ensure that surpluses or obsolete stocks are taken out.
	Maintaining record of receipts as well as issuance of items that are going out of the warehouse so as to ensure accuracy and completeness
	Reconciliation of physical stock vis-a-vis book records or stock in the system Ensure zero discrepancy as per content of the purchase order (PO) vis-a-vis the packing list/invoice from the supplier.
	Oversee the stacking of goods in an orderly system within the stock location system so that the stock can be stored easily and retrieved whenever there is a requirement.
	Undertake the function of stock taking and confirm the periodic stock on a regular basis by working closely with the designated staff members
	Ensure proper supervision of the offloading process, the subsequent arrangement of merchandise, material, etc., and consignment so that it can be accessed and identified easily
	To ensure the correct and timely valuation of the inventory and to be involved in directing and managing procedures related to offloading, packing and unpacking
	Update the City Inventory Management - Database with new items and their respective quantities.
	Ensure the safekeeping of all asset spare keys belonging to MAX
	Ensure retrieval of trackers from the storage rack/location upon receiving a satisfactorily filled Store Requisition Form.
	Inspect the items received from suppliers and ensure quality conformance. If items do not conform to agreed quality levels, reject such items.
	Ensure that the bin cards for each SKU are updated


Requirements


	A degree in Finance, Accounting or any relevant fields, Minimum of a BSc/HND.
	Minimum experience of 2 years.


Skills and Abilities.


	Strong interpersonal and communication (written and oral) skills.
	Excellent understanding of Inventory Control principles and practices.
	Proficient in MS Office/Google Workspace.
	Good Math’s Skills Critical and analytical thinking.
	Accuracy and Attention to detail.
	Confidentiality and Thoroughness.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Battery Swap Station Attendant

Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos

Description


	The Battery Swap Station Attendant is responsible for overseeing the operations of the battery swap station for electric motorcycles.
	This role includes monitoring battery swaps, assisting riders, ensuring proper parking of motorcycles at the end of the day, and managing the charging of batteries overnight for next-day use.


Key Responsibilities


	Monitor Operations: Supervise the daily operations of the battery swap station, ensuring efficient and safe battery swaps for electric motorcycles.
	Assist Riders: Provide assistance to riders during the battery swap process, ensuring they understand the procedure and feel comfortable with the operation.
	Battery Management: Ensure all batteries are properly charged and maintained. Monitor battery levels and perform routine checks to confirm functionality.
	Parking Coordination: Oversee the proper parking of motorcycles at the end of each day, ensuring all bikes are secured and accessible for riders the following morning.
	Charging Supervision: Manage the overnight charging of batteries, ensuring all batteries are fully charged and ready for use the next day.
	Record Keeping: Maintain accurate records of battery swaps, usage statistics, and any issues encountered during operations.
	Safety Compliance: Adhere to all safety protocols and guidelines to ensure a safe environment for riders and staff.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND or equivalent.
	1-2 years of prior experience in a customer service or technical support role is a plus.
	Strong customer service skills and a friendly demeanor.
	Basic technical aptitude and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to follow procedures and guidelines accurately
	Attention to detail and a commitment to maintaining equipment in good condition.
	Good communication skills and the ability to interact effectively with customers.
	Physical ability to lift and handle batteries and perform light maintenance tasks.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

title: Job Openings at Avocado Virtual Solutions
content:
Avocado Virtual Solutions (AVS) is a professional recruitment agency and business support service dedicated to helping entrepreneurs, small businesses, and busy professionals streamline their operations. We specialize in administrative support, customer service, social media management, recruitment assistance with onboarding, and business/company branding. Our mission is to help clients save time, enhance productivity, and build strong, recognizable brands while they focus on growing their businesses.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.)  Virtual Social Media Assistant

Job Location: Fully Remote
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



About Role


	We are a growing financial services company seeking a Virtual Social Media Assistant to build, manage, and grow our online presence. The ideal candidate will be creative, detail-oriented, and knowledgeable about social media growth strategies, especially within the UK market.


Key Responsibilities


	Create and set up new social media pages for the business on all social media platforms starting with Instagram, Facebook, and TikTok
	Develop and implement strategies to grow followers, engagement, and reach
	Plan, manage, and optimize sponsored adverts and paid promotions
	Create a clear, comfortable, and consistent content calendar aligned with business goals
	Design engaging graphics and visual content for social media posts
	Edit short-form videos (Reels, TikTok videos) suitable for financial services content
	Manage daily social media activities including posting, captions, hashtags, and basic community engagement
	Ensure content aligns with brand tone, compliance, and financial services standards
	Apply basic UK marketing strategies and audience targeting techniques


Requirements & Qualifications


	Proven experience managing Instagram and TikTok business pages
	Good basic understanding of UK digital marketing basics (audience behavior, trends, ad targeting)
	Strong skills in graphic design (Canva, Photoshop, or similar tools)
	Video editing skills for short-form content (CapCut, InShot, Premiere Pro, etc.)
	Ability to create structured and realistic content calendars
	Creative thinking with attention to detail
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
	Basic knowledge of social media analytics and performance tracking


What We’re Looking For


	Someone proactive and growth-focused
	A creative individual who understands how to market financial services professionally
	A virtual assistant who can take ownership of the brand’s social media presence.


Salary & Benefits


	Salary: N70,000 per month.
	Remote and flexible working environment
	Opportunity to grow with a fast-expanding financial services brand.


Application Closing Date: 14th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Applications to: avsabujahr@gmail.com using the Job Positiion as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Human Resource Manager

Job Location: Jabi, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking an experienced and people-focused Human Resources Manager to lead and manage all HR functions across the organization.
	The HR Manager will be responsible for building efficient HR systems, overseeing recruitment and talent management, ensuring compliance with labor laws, and fostering a productive and positive workplace culture that aligns with the company’s business goals.
	This role requires a strategic thinker who can balance employee relations with business needs while supporting leadership in driving organizational growth and performance.


Key Responsibilities


	Promote hotel rooms, services, and offers to attract new guests
	Develop and execute marketing campaigns (online and offline)
	Manage the hotel’s social media pages and online presence
	Create engaging content (flyers, posts, short videos, promotions)
	Drive corporate bookings, partnerships, and walk-in clients
	Handle customer inquiries and follow up on leads
	Monitor competitor activities and market trends
	Track marketing performance and report results to management


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Time-to-hire and quality of recruited talent
	Employee retention and turnover rates
	Effectiveness of performance management and appraisal systems
	Compliance with HR policies and labor regulations
	Employee engagement and workplace satisfaction levels


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field with 3–5 years of experience in an HR role, with at least 1 year in a managerial position
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labor laws and HR best practices
	Excellent interpersonal, communication, and conflict management skills
	Ability to handle confidential information with professionalism
	Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office / Google Workspace


What we Offer


	Opportunity to shape HR systems and company culture
	Direct collaboration with senior leadership
	Career growth and long-term development opportunities


Salary
N200,000 / Month

Application Closing Date: 15th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Applications to: avsabujahr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Compliance and Regulatory Officer

Job Location: Jabi, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

About Role


	The Compliance & Regulatory Officer will play a critical role in safeguarding Sylvastar Group’s operations by ensuring strict adherence to all applicable laws, regulatory requirements, and internal policies.
	This role supports management by identifying compliance risks, maintaining regulatory standards across all subsidiaries, and promoting a strong culture of corporate governance and ethical conduct within the Group.


Key Responsibilities


	Ensure compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, and corporate governance requirements
	Monitor regulatory updates and advise management on implementation and risk impact
	Develop, review, and enforce internal compliance policies and procedures
	Maintain statutory records, licenses, permits, and regulatory filings
	Conduct internal compliance audits and risk assessments
	Liaise with regulatory authorities, legal advisers, and external auditors
	Investigate compliance breaches and recommend corrective actions
	Prepare and submit compliance reports to management
	Train staff on regulatory and compliance requirements


Requirements & Qualifications


	HND/BSc in Law, Business Administration, Accounting, or related field
	2–4 years of experience in compliance, regulatory, or risk-related roles
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian regulatory frameworks and corporate governance
	Excellent documentation, analytical, and reporting skills
	High level of integrity, discretion, and professionalism
	Strong communication and stakeholder management skills


Personal Attributes:


	Ethical and principled
	Detail-oriented and organized
	Proactive and solutions-driven
	Ability to work independently.


Salary
N250,000 per month.

Application Closing Date: 6th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their applications and CV to: avsabujacareer@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
